root.OrganizationName: Consultation Center of the Diocese of Albany

notes.note: A nonprofit Mental Health Center which provides quality professional psychological counseling services and educational programs in the area of mental health to individuals and groups.
Provides individual therapy, marriage and couples counseling, psychological testing and consultative services to individuals and groups in matters calling for psychological expertise.
Provides a variety of different kinds of therapy groups.
Offers lectures and workshops in the area of mental health and personal growth. The Center also offers specialized workshops and training programs to meet the needs of various groups.
Provides a program of individual spiritual direction for any person interested in developing a deeper relationship with God.

note.note: Provides individual, family, marital and group psychological counseling-therapy by certified trained therapists. The staff provides services for the Young Married program and assessments for second marriages. Consultation and training programs are offered upon request. Workshops and lectures offered on select topics.

notes.note: The Office of Pastoral Care provides support to the work of Pastoral Care Coordinators, Lay Ecclesial Ministers and Volunteer Visitors, providing resources, training and consultation.

note.note: Provides prevention education to Catholic schools in the Albany Diocese.

root.OrganizationName: The La Salle School Foundation of Albany

notes.note: St. Anne's offers Residential, Educational, and Community-Based Counseling services to youth, adults, and families. We operate a residential facility for girls 12-21, a junior and senior High School for girls 12-21, a preschool for boys and girls ages 3-5, a community-based counseling program for adults, boys, girls, and families; after school programs for boys and girls 13-18; and a Street Outreach Program for boys and girls who are homeless or living on the streets. We have an expertise in working with youth, adults, and families who have been sexually victimized or are struggling with sexual aggressive behaviors. We contract with County Departments of Social Services and School Districts; we take third party payments from insurance companies and we make arrangement on a sliding scale for clients to pay as they receive services.

Residential and day treatment, group homes and foster family programs for children with special needs. Community based prevention programs; Parent aides; Parent Training; Transitional Program for Homeless Families.
